review.body:
**Actionable comments posted: 3**
ğŸ”­ Outside diff range comments (4)
cratis-core/src/config.rs (2)
`141-170`: **Docs for update_config are stale after signature change** The examples and argument list donâ€™t mention the new config_path parameter and show the old two-arg call site. Update the docs to include config_path in examples and arguments. Suggested example update: ```rust /// let new_addr = Value::String("0.0.0.0:9000".to_string()); /// update_config("server.address", "/path/to/config.yml", new_addr)?; ``` --- `192-201`: **Bug: creating missing nested keys inserts Null, causing recursion to fail** When an intermediate key is missing, you insert Value::Null and recurse, which will immediately error because Null is not a Mapping. Replace with a Mapping for intermediate nodes; only set the leaf directly. ```diff Value::Mapping(map) => { let key = Value::String(keys[0].to_string()); if let Some(v) = map.get_mut(&key) { update_recursive(v, &keys[1..], new_value) } else { - // If key doesn't exist, create it - map.insert(key.clone(), Value::Null); - update_recursive(map.get_mut(&key).unwrap(), &keys[1..], new_value) + // If key doesn't exist, create nested mappings as needed + if keys.len() == 1 { + map.insert(key.clone(), new_value); + Ok(()) + } else { + map.insert(key.clone(), Value::Mapping(Default::default())); + update_recursive(map.get_mut(&key).unwrap(), &keys[1..], new_value) + } } }, ```
cratis-core/src/utils.rs (1)
`281-294`: **Borrowed temporary bug: referencing a cloned temporary Vec** Youâ€™re taking a reference to a temporary created by clone().unwrap_or_default(), which will not live long enough and should not compile. Own the Vec instead. Apply: ```diff - let config: &CratisConfig = crate::config::get_config_cli(); - - let exclude_dirs: &Vec = &config.backup.exclude.clone().unwrap_or_default(); + let config: &CratisConfig = crate::config::get_config_cli(); + let exclude_dirs: Vec = config.backup.exclude.clone().unwrap_or_default(); let mut exclude_patterns: Vec = Vec::new(); - if !exclude_dirs.is_empty() { - for pattern in exclude_dirs.iter() { + if !exclude_dirs.is_empty() { + for pattern in exclude_dirs.iter() { match Pattern::new(pattern) { Ok(p) => exclude_patterns.push(p), Err(e) => display_msg(Some(&CratisError::ConfigError(format!("Invalid exclusion pattern '{}': {}", pattern, e))), CratisErrorLevel::Fatal, None) } } } ```
cratis-cli/src/main.rs (1)
`32-35`: **Fix use-after-move and unnecessary unwrap in match on backup_now()** result is moved into the match; referencing result.unwrap() inside the Ok arm is a use-after-move and will fail to compile. Match the awaited result directly and use the bound value. ```diff - let result: CratisResult = backup_now().await; - match result { - Ok(_) => display_msg(None, CratisErrorLevel::Info, Some(result.unwrap())), - Err(e) => display_msg(Some(&e), CratisErrorLevel::Warning, None), - } + match backup_now().await { + Ok(msg) => display_msg(None, CratisErrorLevel::Info, Some(msg)), + Err(e) => display_msg(Some(&e), CratisErrorLevel::Warning, None), + } ```
ğŸ§¹ Nitpick comments (15)
cratis-core/src/error.rs (1)
`93-94`: **Consider avoiding std::process::exit in a core library function** Exiting the process from core makes callers (CLI/API) harder to test and recover. Consider returning a Result or delegating fatal handling to the caller instead.
cratis-core/src/config.rs (4)
`10-11`: **Avoid absolute, user-specific TEMP paths** Hardcoding an absolute development path makes builds non-portable. Prefer one of: - Environment-variable override with a sensible default. - XDG config directory resolution (e.g., $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/cratis/...). - Relative paths in workspace for dev builds behind a feature flag. ```diff -pub static TEMP_API_CONFIG_PATH: &str = "/home/raphael/Development/Cratis/cratis-api/config.yml"; +pub static TEMP_API_CONFIG_PATH: &str = "cratis-api/config.yml"; // TODO: load from env/XDG ``` --- `95-116`: **Simplify get_config_cli; unreachable branch is not needed** With load_config handling failure via display_msg + exit, you can simplify control flow. ```diff pub fn get_config_cli() -> &'static CratisConfig { - if CONFIG_CLI.get().is_none() { - load_config(TEMP_CONFIG_PATH, false); - - if CONFIG_CLI.get().is_none() { - display_msg(Some(&CratisError::ConfigError("Unable to load config".to_string())), CratisErrorLevel::Fatal, None); - unreachable!() - } else { - CONFIG_CLI.get().unwrap() - } - } else { - CONFIG_CLI.get().unwrap() - } + if CONFIG_CLI.get().is_none() { + load_config(TEMP_CONFIG_PATH, false); + } + CONFIG_CLI.get().expect("CLI config must be initialized by load_config()") } ``` --- `118-139`: **Mirror the same simplification in get_config_api** Same rationale as for CLI. ```diff pub fn get_config_api() -> &'static CratisServerConfig { - if CONFIG_API.get().is_none() { - load_config(TEMP_API_CONFIG_PATH, true); - - if CONFIG_API.get().is_none() { - display_msg(Some(&CratisError::ConfigError("Unable to load config".to_string())), CratisErrorLevel::Fatal, None); - unreachable!() - } else { - CONFIG_API.get().unwrap() - } - } else { - CONFIG_API.get().unwrap() - } + if CONFIG_API.get().is_none() { + load_config(TEMP_API_CONFIG_PATH, true); + } + CONFIG_API.get().expect("API config must be initialized by load_config()") } ``` --- `71-92`: **Note: Config updates donâ€™t refresh in-memory OnceCell caches** After update_config writes to disk, CONFIG_CLI/CONFIG_API are not reloaded (OnceCell cannot be set twice). Consider providing a reload_config or switching to Lazy with RwLock for live reloads, if hot-reload is desired.
cratis-cli/src/cli.rs (1)
`168-172`: **Make API endpoint and token configurable (from config)** Hardcoded API URL and test token will block real usage. You already have server.address and auth_token in CratisConfig::server; wire them in. ```diff - let api_url = "http://localhost:8080/upload"; // TODO: Make this configurable - let auth_token = "test"; // TODO: Load it from config, write auth token generator + let api_url = format!("{}/upload", config.server.address.trim_end_matches('/')); + let auth_token = &config.server.auth_token; ```
cratis-api/src/handler/authentication.rs (3)
`193-199`: **Avoid cloning the JWT secret unnecessarily** You can borrow the secret and use as_bytes() to avoid allocating a String. ```diff - let secret: String = get_config_api().settings.jwt.clone(); + let secret: &str = get_config_api().settings.jwt.as_str(); - if secret.is_empty() { + if secret.is_empty() { display_msg(Some(&CratisError::TokenError("JWT Secret is empty!".to_string())), CratisErrorLevel::Warning, None); return None } - let encoding_key: EncodingKey = EncodingKey::from_secret(secret.as_bytes()); + let encoding_key: EncodingKey = EncodingKey::from_secret(secret.as_bytes()); ``` --- `200-209`: **Consider adding exp to JWT claims and validating it** Tokens never expire (validation.validate_exp = false and no exp in claims). For better security, add an exp claim and validate it. Example: ```rust #[derive(Debug, Serialize, Deserialize, Clone)] struct Claims { device_id: String, exp: usize, // seconds since epoch } // In generate_jwt: let exp = (std::time::SystemTime::now() + std::time::Duration::from_secs(3600)) .duration_since(std::time::UNIX_EPOCH).unwrap().as_secs() as usize; let claims = Claims { device_id, exp }; // In decode_token: let mut validation = Validation::new(Algorithm::HS256); validation.validate_exp = true; ``` --- `212-217`: **Same nit: borrow secret in decode_token** Mirror the borrowing change and keep the empty-secret guard. ```diff - let secret: String = get_config_api().settings.jwt.clone(); + let secret: &str = get_config_api().settings.jwt.as_str(); if secret.is_empty() { display_msg(Some(&CratisError::TokenError("JWT Secret is empty!".to_string())), CratisErrorLevel::Warning, None); return Err(jsonwebtoken::errors::Error::from(jsonwebtoken::errors::ErrorKind::InvalidKeyFormat)); } ```
cratis-api/src/main.rs (4)
`18-20`: **Avoid eager config load; rely on get_config_api or handle errors consistently** get_config_api() already lazy-loads the API config. Calling load_config here is redundant and uses expect(), which panics rather than following your display_msg-based error handling. Recommend removing this eager load to avoid duplication and inconsistency. ```diff - // Load config - load_config(TEMP_API_CONFIG_PATH, true); ``` --- `14-14`: **Prefer injecting DB via Axum State over a global static** A global Lazy> works, but pushing DB via Router::with_state and axum::extract::State improves testability, modularity, and reduces tight coupling. Consider moving to app state when convenient (will require minor handler adjustments). --- `35-36`: **Handle bind/serve errors explicitly; avoid unwraps and use SocketAddr for clarity** Unwrap will panic without context. Since you already have a display/error system, report failures and exit gracefully. Also, building the address via SocketAddr is more idiomatic and type-safe than formatting a string. ```diff - let listener = tokio::net::TcpListener::bind(format!("0.0.0.0:{}", get_config_api().settings.port)).await.unwrap(); - axum::serve(listener, app).await.unwrap(); + let port = get_config_api().settings.port; + let addr = std::net::SocketAddr::from(([0, 0, 0, 0], port)); + let listener = tokio::net::TcpListener::bind(addr).await.unwrap_or_else(|e| { + display_msg(Some(&CratisError::ConfigError(format!("Failed to bind on {addr}: {e}"))), CratisErrorLevel::Fatal, None); + unreachable!() + }); + if let Err(e) = axum::serve(listener, app).await { + display_msg(Some(&CratisError::ConfigError(format!("Server error: {e}"))), CratisErrorLevel::Fatal, None); + } ``` --- `1-3`: **Cleanup: remove unused imports and the unused_imports allowance once settled** middleware and the error imports are currently unused (commented code). Consider removing #[allow(unused_imports)] and unused imports when the routes/auth layer stabilizes. Also applies to: 9-9
cratis-cli/src/main.rs (2)
`11-11`: **load_config panics on missing/invalid config; consider graceful handling** load_config() uses expect() internally, so a missing or invalid TEMP_CONFIG_PATH will panic. For a CLI UX, consider changing cratis-core::config::load_config to return a Result and handle it here with display_msg, or preflight-check the file and create a default if absent. --- `21-21`: **Config update call looks correct; verify key path aligns with CLI config schema** Passing the path explicitly is a nice improvement. Ensure server.auth_token belongs to the CLI config file structure to avoid creating unexpected keys.

issue.title: Inaccurate description of authenticationManager in reference documentation
issue.body: **Describe the bug** The [description of OAuth2 Authorization Endpoint](https://docs.spring.io/spring-authorization-server/reference/protocol-endpoints.html#oauth2-authorization-endpoint) in the reference documentation states: > OAuth2AuthorizationEndpointFilter is configured with the following defaults: > > ... > > AuthenticationManagerâ€‰â€”â€‰An AuthenticationManager composed of OAuth2AuthorizationCodeRequestAuthenticationProvider and OAuth2AuthorizationConsentAuthenticationProvider. However I see that in the most recent version of Spring Authorization Server 1.5.1 `authenticationManager` for all filters is populated using the same object obtained by `httpSecurity.getSharedObject(AuthenticationManager.class)`. See [source code](https://github.com/wheleph/spring-authorization-server/blob/d43c28348a7788ce12f05f6498ed677f078a45df/oauth2-authorization-server/src/main/java/org/springframework/security/oauth2/server/authorization/config/annotation/web/configurers/OAuth2AuthorizationEndpointConfigurer.java#L257) Also this inaccuracy is visible in debug session:

pull_request.title: Add tests for SSE connection lifecycle and goroutine cleanup
pull_request.body:
This commit introduces comprehensive test suites for Server-Sent Events (SSE) connections, focusing on lifecycle management and ensuring proper goroutine cleanup. The tests cover various scenarios, including manual disconnection, context cancellation, and concurrent connections, to prevent memory leaks and ensure robust connection handling.

Key changes include:
- New test file `sse_connection_test.go` for v2 SSE endpoints.
- New test file `sse_connection_test.go` for v1 SSE endpoints.
- Implementation of tests to verify cleanup of goroutines after SSE connections are closed.

These additions enhance the reliability of SSE implementations and address critical memory leak issues identified in previous reviews.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- Tests
  - Expanded automated coverage for streaming endpoints, validating connection lifecycle, cancellations, concurrent connections, timeouts, rate limiting, and resource cleanup with leak detection.
  - Added stress tests for rapid connect/disconnect scenarios and duplicate connection handling.
  - Introduced benchmarks for connection setup and event streaming performance.
- Chores
  - No user-facing behavior changes; improvements focus on test robustness and reliability verification.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
